meanings.definition: To be extremely disappointed or upset.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he felt guttered and sad.
meanings.sent2: She guttered when she found out her favorite show was canceled.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked guttered when his toy got stuck under the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her face guttered with disappointment when she saw the final exam grade.
meanings.sent5: The children's faces were guttered when the ice cream truck drove away without stopping.

meanings.definition: To have a gutter installed on a building.
meanings.sent1: The workers guttered the new house to prevent rainwater damage.
meanings.sent2: They guttered the entire roof to collect rainwater efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The builders will gutter the house tomorrow to protect the walls.
meanings.sent4: The old building was guttered to channel rainwater away from the foundation.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew guttered the mansion with shiny new gutters.

meanings.definition: To clean out debris from a gutter.
meanings.sent1: He guttered the leaves and twigs from the gutter after the storm.
meanings.sent2: She guttered the gutter to prevent clogging during heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The guttering task became a family affair as they cleaned out the debris.
meanings.sent4: The guttering job was messy but necessary to avoid water damage.
meanings.sent5: They guttered the gutter with care to ensure proper drainage.
